name: Coursera
slogan: Universal access to the world's best education
description: We envision a world where anyone, anywhere can transform their life by accessing the world’s best learning experience. At Coursera, we are building a scalable, personalized learning experience that supports each learner in achieving their goals, and a data-rich teaching experience that enables instructors to reimagine education at every scale. Our mission and vision unite our team; above all, we share a common passion for our ambitious goals. We’re also a strong, fun-loving community that shares meals, music, volunteering, sports, and more. If we sound like a group you’d like to join, check out www.coursera.org/jobs!

jobs.title: Affiliate Marketing Associate (contract)
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
The Marketing & Communications team is responsible for connecting the world to lifelong transformative learning. They also work to shape public conversations on the future of education and work. The team is segmented into four areas of focus: Consumer Marketing, Enterprise Marketing, Brand & Creative, and Communications. The team is currently focused on expanding the reach of Coursera’s brand, attracting students to degree programs, bringing new customers to Coursera for Business, and creating a marketing system that nurtures learners throughout their professional lives.   
As an Affiliate Marketing Associate on the Consumer Marketing team, you'll manage our top affiliate accounts, recruit new affiliates and grow our affiliate campaigns in order to drive revenue for Coursera. On a day to day, you will manage existing affiliate relationships and manage both outreach and inbound for new affiliate relationships. On a long-term basis, this role has the potential to directly support the 3-year vision of the company by being at the forefront of one of Coursera's most profitable and successful channels for new customer acquisition.  
To be successful in this role, you will drive top and longtail affiliates to promote Coursera through campaigns that allow the channel to hit acquisition targets consistently and profitably. You will work with the paid advertising team to leverage learnings from other paid channels into the affiliate accounts you manage to drive new customer acquisition. You partner with our analysts to apply the data-driven insights from affiliates across the entire program, and you work cross-functionally with brand and product to ensure we are driving performance and effectively communicating our brand.  
Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.title: Americas Field Marketing Manager, Enterprise
jobs.description:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 200 of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 48 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. Over 2,200 companies use the company’s enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera is backed by leading venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, International Finance Corporation, Laureate Education Inc., and Learn Capital.  
At Coursera, our Marketing and Communications team is responsible for brand development, product marketing, PR, and acquisition and retention marketing for learners, enterprises, and university partners. We’re looking for a Field Marketing Manager who can help us empower organizations to attract, retain, and grow talented employees by providing them with access to the world’s best career-relevant online education.   
You will work with the Americas Regional Marketing Lead and Regional Sales Directors to drive business growth by building brand awareness and generating sales leads via multiple marketing channels. You have strong organizational and project management skills, a data-driven approach, a keen eye for detail, and the ability to confidently design and execute in-person and online events and digital campaigns You are a creative, motivated, and collaborative individual who values flexibility and the opportunity to make an impact.

jobs.title: Assistant Director, University Partnerships
jobs.description:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 200 of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 48 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. Over 2,200 companies use the company’s enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera is backed by leading venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, International Finance Corporation, Laureate Education Inc., and Learn Capital.  
The University Partnerships Team oversees and nurtures all of the relationships with institutional and faculty partners, collaborating with partners to align institutional and Coursera objectives around a shared mission. In particular, the Strategic Partnerships Team is responsible for identifying and sourcing high-quality content, from single courses to degrees, that push the boundaries of pedagogical innovation. Associate Directors have deep familiarity with our product and organization, our partners’ structure and mission, and the landscape in which we operate.  
As part of the team, you will manage a portfolio of universities, working closely with them to build trusting relationships, proactively understanding their context and concerns, and help Coursera leverage such partnerships to achieve its goals.Your work will demand that you can interface with a range of stakeholders from senior-level leadership to instructors and program managers. Central to your work is the ability to demonstrate and ensure Coursera’s value to the institution while shaping a strategy for the partnership that drives long-term engagement.

jobs.title: Bilingual Sales Development Representative - LATAM
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
In 2016, we launched Coursera for Business, partnering with companies and governments around the world to provide access to curated skill development for their employees. This is now our fastest growing business with nearly 1000 customers including many logos from the Fortune 500.   
The Sales Development Team is a critical component of our growth plan. All inbound and outbound engagement with prospective customers starts with the SDR team. As a LATAM Sales Development Representative (SDR) you will be responsible for qualifying leads for our sales team. You will work closely with sales and marketing teams to ensure we operate as a seamless organization to build our pipeline of business.  
Your knowledge of edtech, and enterprise learning combined with superior communication skills and analytical abilities, will shape Coursera’s B2B business to help us provide more access to education globally.  
Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.title: Corporate Paralegal
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
We’re looking to hire an intelligent, organized, and energetic Paralegal for our Legal & Compliance Department. You will be responsible for proactively providing support for the day-to-day operations of the General Counsel and Legal & Compliance Department. You will be a professionally established individual with comprehensive executive administrative or paralegal experience. Your role will be to partner with the GC, Senior Corporate Counsel, and team to manage schedules and logistics, assist with Board and corporate governance matters, assist with drafting, document production and signature processes, manage due diligence projects, conduct legal research, and maintain corporate records. A critical part of this role is to understand the priorities of the company and the Legal & Compliance Department to effectively prioritize time among many conflicting priorities and serve as a reliable point of contact/liaison for internal and external parties. You will join a mid-sized Legal and Compliance team to help build Coursera’s platform, and work across the entire organization (especially with sales, finance, business development, and HR) in service of Coursera’s growth and long-term success. Your ability to exercise both sound judgement and discretion is key.  
To be successful in this role, we’re looking for someone who is passionate about education and energized by the challenges of working in a startup, has a strong desire to learn, is eager to tackle projects beyond the traditional job function, and wishes to function integrally as part of an interdisciplinary team. The person in this role requires keen attention to detail, the ability to meet deadlines, and the ability to efficiently juggle multiple high priority requests, all while interfacing professionally with people inside and outside the company. You will engage with all levels of employees and management, so communication skills are vital to strong working relationships.Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)]

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager, Universities
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
We are looking for a Customer Success Manager to manage Coursera’s University customers. Universities are increasingly turning to Coursera to power on-campus learning with Coursera’s course and product offerings. In this important role, you will be part of a small-yet-high-powered team that is tasked with building out Coursera’s “Coursera-for-Campus” strategy. As part of the Customer Success team, you will manage a portfolio largely comprised of university customers. Your performance will depend on your ability to balance account renewal, growth and customer satisfaction.  In this cross-functional role, you can expect to work with members within Sales, Implementation, Partnerships, Marketing, Product, Finance and Legal.

jobs.title: Director, Product Management
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
In 2016, we began hosting accredited online Masters degrees provided by our university partners, which ​provide ​a​ more convenient, lower-cost,​​ “stackable”​ means of earning credentials identical ​to their ​​traditional​ on-campus​​ counterparts. We also launched Coursera for Business, partnering with enterprise companies around the world to provide access to curated skill development for their employees.  
As the Director, Product Management at Coursera, you will lead our Degrees product team. In this role you will own the vision, strategy, and roadmap for our degrees product. You will manage a team of high-performing product managers and enable educators to create innovative and transformative credentials for our global learners. You will be partnering with the Degrees Business Leader to jointly drive the key success metrics for the Degrees business.   
You will be responsible for developing the first hand understanding of our customer needs, translating them into long lasting product value for our customers and building our product platform in a highly scalable way. You will collaborate with engineering, design, research, data science, program management and university partnerships teams to contribute to the development of product roadmap. You will also be working with partnerships team to pitch and demo the product value proposition.  
Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.title: Enterprise Account Executive (Bangalore/Remote)
jobs.description:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 190 of the world's top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 43 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. 2,000 companies trust our enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera for Government equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. Coursera is backed by investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group.  
The Enterprise Solutions team serves global organizations, including leading companies, governments, and nonprofits, who seek to upskill or retrain their workforce with the world’s best education. This team is made up of three sub-teams: Sales, Customer Success, and Revenue Strategy & Operations. The teams operate globally and have members based out of our offices in Mountain View, New York, London, Gurgaon, and Abu Dhabi.   
We are looking for an Account Executive who can help us empower enterprises across India to offer the world’s best education to their employees.  
Our ideal candidate is a passionate, entrepreneurial sales manager who can prospect, develop, and close enterprise deals in India. You should have extensive experience of sales to large enterprises. Your knowledge of edtech, enterprise learning / training combined with superior communication skills and analytical abilities will shape Coursera’s enterprise business.  
This is a full-time employee position with Coursera India. **This will be a remote position based out of Bangalore.**  
Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.title: IT - SaaS System Administrator
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
Coursera is looking for a capable, motivated SaaS System Administrator to take over all aspects of the configuration and maintenance of our systems, network and automation. We run a fast-paced, but casual office, in a supportive atmosphere. As part of a small IT team, you'll wear lots of hats and gain plenty of valuable experience.  
This position will be initially responsible for day to day administration of Okta, Active Directory, and other best of breed SaaS applications. You’ll provide cloud identity and infrastructure support and work closely with our software development, desktop support, help desk and other departments to insure a superior experience for our clients. This is a hands-on position and applicants must have significant experience executing detailed project initiatives in order to add to our reputation of Coursera’s IT Team.   
Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!

You’ll provide cloud identity and infrastructure support and work closely with our software development, desktop support, help desk and other departments to insure a superior experience for our clients. This is a hands-on position and applicants must have significant experience executing detailed project initiatives in order to add to our reputation of Coursera’s IT Team.

Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!

jobs.title: IT Support Specialist
jobs.description:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 200 of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 48 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. Over 2,200 companies use the company’s enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera is backed by leading venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, International Finance Corporation, Laureate Education Inc., and Learn Capital.  
Coursera is looking for a capable, motivated IT Support Specialist to help support our growing team at Coursera and ensure we have the best working environment technically. This is a forward facing position which requires versatility, attention to detail and troubleshooting skills. In this role, you will be the front facing contact to manage IT requests ranging from break/fix issues, SaaS administration, asset management, MacBook deployment, onboarding, and infrastructure engineering. We run a fast-paced, but casual office, in a supportive atmosphere. As part of a small IT team, you'll wear lots of hats and gain plenty of valuable experience.  
We’re at a very special time in the life of the company, when we are just starting to have a huge impact on millions of lives, and yet are still a small company such that every individual here has a huge role to play in driving where we are going as a company.  
Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.title: Learner Services Degree Specialist
jobs.description:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 200 of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 48 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. Over 2,200 companies use the company’s enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera is backed by leading venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, International Finance Corporation, Laureate Education Inc., and Learn Capital.  
The Learner Services team strategizes, builds, and delivers support and services at scale to millions of learners on Coursera, to help them succeed in their courses, specializations, and degrees. The team deeply understands learner needs, and partners closely with Product and Engineering teams to build data-driven automation and turn learner insights into product and platform improvements.  
You will be part of a team responsible for reinventing the online degree experience and expanding access to learners worldwide. With a blend of top notch project management skills, communications skills, and deep learner understanding,  you will act as the primary interface between Coursera, higher ed learners and university stakeholders invested in student success.  
As part of the Content & Product Services team, you will work closely with our University Partners, Business and Operations Leadership, Product, and Engineering teams to create the best learning experience for non-traditional students around the globe.  
Check out life at Coursera on [**The Muse!**  ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.title: Marketing Associate (Contract)
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
In 2016, we began hosting accredited online Master’s degrees provided by our university partners, which ​provide ​a​ more convenient, lower-cost,​​ “stackable”​ means of earning credentials identical ​to their ​​traditional​ on-campus​​ counterparts. We also launched Professional Certificates that prepare learners for a new career in an in-demand field in less than a year, with no prior experience or education required.  
As our Marketing Associate, you will support the Certificate Marketing team by collaborating in key partner marketing campaigns. You’ll play a key role in managing the execution of key marketing activities monitoring conversations across a variety of channels that inform marketing strategies, explore opportunities to expand reach in various learning communities, and identifying learner success stories. You’ll also have an opportunity to build reporting templates and dashboards to help stakeholders across Coursera and our partners to leverage these insights to inform marketing tactics.  
Our ideal candidate is eager to learn new marketing skills, has excellent communication and writing skills, has experience with working with partners, is someone who can effectively manage and monitor on-going projects to ensure timely execution, and is a passionate champion for our vision to enable anyone, anywhere to transform their lives through access to the world’s best learning experience.  
This is a 12 month, 40 hour/week, contract position.

jobs.title: Marketing Coordinator (Colombia)
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
We’re looking for university students who want to help other students discover Coursera! We believe that everyone should have the opportunity to learn, change, and grow and that access to high quality education should be available to everyone. As a Marketing Coordinator, with the support of Coursera marketing leads, you’ll generate market insights to help position Coursera to university students and ideate and prepare to launch regional Campus Marketing Programs that can scale to thousands of universities and millions of students. Successful programs will help students discover a new resource for building key skills for their future!  
**This is a 12 week contract position where you’ll be working 30-40 hours per week.**  
**TO APPLY:** Please apply online with your resume and a cover letter describing how you’d share Coursera at your campus in order to be considered for this opportunity. Bonus if you include any Coursera certificates that you’ve earned!

At Coursera, our Marketing and Communications team is responsible for brand development, product marketing, PR, and acquisition and retention marketing for learners, enterprises, and university partners. We’re looking for a Regional Marketing Lead for Europe and the Middle East who can help us empower our enterprise customers to attract, retain, and grow talented employees by providing them with access to the world’s best career-relevant online education.   
You will work with the Global Demand Generation Team and EMEA Sales Leadership to drive business growth by generating leads and sales pipeline via multiple marketing channels. You have strong organizational and project management skills, a data-driven approach, a keen eye for detail, and the ability to confidently design and execute in-person and online events and digital campaigns You are a creative, motivated, and collaborative individual who values flexibility and the opportunity to make an impact.

jobs.title: Regional Sales Director, Coursera for Campus - EMEA
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
The Enterprise Solutions team serves global organizations, including leading companies, governments, universities and nonprofits, who seek to upskill or retrain their workforce, staff and students with the world’s best education. The teams operate globally and have members based out of our offices in Mountain View, New York, London, Gurgaon, and Abu Dhabi. As part of Coursera’s EMEA team, you will play a key role in increasing global access to a world-class education. You will lead an initial team of AEs who are dedicated to positioning our Coursera for Campus offering.   
The role also requires working across the organization (with business development, product, university partnerships, and legal) in service of Coursera’s growth and long-term success. Coursera for Campus is the fastest growing part of the Enterprise business.   
You are a passionate, entrepreneurial sales leader and you will be responsible for driving your team’s success and delivering the teams opportunity creation and revenue goals in the Coursera for Campus space. You will have experience running teams selling directly to universities and have operated in a fast growing businesses. You thrive on a fast paced environment, rapidly changing and adapting to new market opportunities.   
Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

You will lead an initial team of AEs who are dedicated to positioning our Coursera for Campus offering.

The role also requires working across the organization (with business development, product, university partnerships, and legal) in service of Coursera’s growth and long-term success. Coursera for Campus is the fastest growing part of the Enterprise business.

You are a passionate, entrepreneurial sales leader and you will be responsible for driving your team’s success and delivering the teams opportunity creation and revenue goals in the Coursera for Campus space. You will have experience running teams selling directly to universities and have operated in a fast growing businesses. You thrive on a fast paced environment, rapidly changing and adapting to new market opportunities.

Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!

jobs.title: Sales and Marketing Operations Manager
jobs.description:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 200 of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 48 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. Over 2,200 companies use the company’s enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera is backed by leading venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, International Finance Corporation, Laureate Education Inc., and Learn Capital.  
The Marketing & Communications team is responsible for connecting the world to lifelong transformative learning. They also work to shape public conversations on the future of education and work. The team is segmented into four areas of focus: Consumer Marketing, Enterprise Marketing, Brand & Creative, and Communications. The team is currently focused on expanding the reach of Coursera’s brand, attracting students to degree programs, bringing new customers to Coursera for Business, and creating a marketing system that nurtures learners throughout their professional lives.   
We are looking for an amazing,  data-driven sales and marketing operations manager to support the consumer and degree businesses.  You will be in charge of managing and optimizing our lead management process for our degrees enrollment team.  You will drive reporting and analytics to understand our enrollment funnel effectiveness and continually refine our process to drive improvement.  You will oversee and administer key systems used to nurture our degree learners. You will document and train our enrollment team on key systems.   
Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.title: Senior Counsel, University Partnerships
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
Legal and Compliance is responsible for managing all legal and regulatory matters, including contracts, corporate governance, general compliance, academic compliance, employment law matters, intellectual property, product counseling, government relations, and claims. The team includes dedicated teams that support every aspect of Coursera's platform, including university, enterprise, and industry partnerships. As part of Coursera’s Legal and Compliance team, you will play a key role in increasing global access to a world-class education. The Counsel or Senior Counsel (depending on experience and qualifications) is responsible for negotiating agreements with university partners (including agreements related to MasterTrack and degree programs). The Counsel/Senior Counsel will support a majority of Coursera’s US-based university partners and will also be provided with opportunities to assist with international matters. The role requires the Counsel/Senior Counsel to identify and advise on business and legal issues of proposed transactions, and to respond in a timely, thoughtful manner to partner and internal stakeholder enquiries. The individual that fills the role is expected to be widely respected by the Legal and Compliance team and throughout the company due to their analytical thinking, savvy risk management, communication skills, and ability to get things done. We expect the Counsel/Senior Counsel to form strong working relationships with internal clients and Coursera’s partners, earn the respect of the teams, and lead through productivity and influence.To be successful in this role, we’re looking for someone who is passionate about business growth and education. We want a candidate who is energized by the challenges of working in a startup, and has a strong desire to learn new areas of law and function integrally as part of an interdisciplinary team. This role will engage with all levels of employees and management, so interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal) are vital to strong working relationships.

Data Engineering is unique at Coursera. Our team doesn’t simply build reports on demand. Rather, we build the semantic infrastructure and products that empower our internal and external customers with the data to innovate and perform their jobs better.We’re looking for a senior data engineer in Toronto who can help us drive data engineering efforts for our platform. In this role, you will work with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy data solutions. Our ideal candidate is an independent, analytically-minded individual with strong data modeling and engineering skills, who shares our passion for education.

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Email Marketing
jobs.description:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 200 of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 48 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. Over 2,200 companies use the company’s enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera is backed by leading venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, International Finance Corporation, Laureate Education Inc., and Learn Capital.  
The Marketing & Communications team is responsible for connecting the world to lifelong transformative learning. They also work to shape public conversations on the future of education and work. The team is segmented into four areas of focus: Consumer Marketing, Enterprise Marketing, Brand & Creative, and Communications. The team is currently focused on expanding the reach of Coursera’s brand, attracting students to degree programs, bringing new customers to Coursera for Business, and creating a marketing system that nurtures learners throughout their professional lives.   
Leading Coursera’s Email Marketing efforts is a unique opportunity to set and drive the global email communications strategy to 45M+ registered learners and meaningfully impact the company’s growth.  In this role, you’ll develop strategies to activate, retain, and convert learners in our core consumer business; incorporate promotion of our degree, certificate, and enterprise offerings into the learner’s email journey; and evolve our program towards a learner-centric lifecycle approach.  You will benefit from strong cross-functional partnerships with Coursera’s Data Science, Product, and Engineering teams, as well as other groups within Marketing & Communications.    
Reporting directly to Coursera’s VP, Consumer Marketing, this visible and strategic role will impact the growth and success of Coursera’s core business, enrich the learner experience, and help further Coursera’s mission to improve lives through education.  The right candidate has rich experience in consumer email and growth marketing, and wants to lead an email program at a large scale and as part of an organization committed to a social mission.    
Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
In 2016, we began hosting accredited online Masters degrees provided by our university partners, which ​provide ​a​ more convenient, lower-cost,​​ “stackable”​ means of earning credentials identical ​to their ​​traditional​ on-campus​​ counterparts. We also launched Coursera for Business, partnering with enterprise companies around the world to provide access to curated skill development for their employees.  
The Senior Manager of Support manages the scaled operations that supports our learners, enterprise clients and partners.  The Senior Manager manages a team of 8+ contributors who run the 3rd party call center, the self serve help centers and all the associated tools. Given our rapid growth, the evolution of our ability to support our varying set or constituents at scale  is a key company initiative. The Senior Manager will own the strategy for growth and be empowered to execute the vision.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer II
jobs.description:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 190 of the world's top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 43 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. 2,000 companies trust our enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera for Government equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. Coursera is backed by investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group.  
As a Senior Product Designer at Coursera you will have the opportunity to take a lead role on the team creating experiences across the Coursera ecosystem. We are in the midst of transforming our offering to schools around the world, leading innovation in how people learn, and broadening our global footprint. The experience of learning and transformation is inherently challenging.   
Your job is to create simplicity from complexity and influence everything from the most micro interaction to most complex system design challenges. Our goals are monumental and we need extraordinary designers to realize them.

Coursera is backed by investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group.  
As Coursera’s enterprise business grows at a meteoric pace, and the Product Management team works to help companies, governments, and nonprofits transform their talent. This team leads our efforts to build a product experience that enables enterprise customers of all sizes across the globe to offer the world’s best education to their employees.  
As a Senior Product Manager for the Enterprise Product, you will lead the effort to build out a product experience that enables companies, governments, and nonprofits to offer the world’s best, lifelong education to their employees and other constituents. You will focus on developing our offering of premium credentials like Degrees and MasterTracks to Enterprise organizations. You will also lead the API Strategy for the Enterprise Platform that enables Coursera to become a part of the internal ecosystems and workflow of our Enterprise Customers. You will take on product initiatives such as discovery for premium credentials, scaled learner success and API integrations with LMS and HRIS systems.  
You will collaborate with engineering, design and other cross-functional teams to execute on a big-thinking roadmap and build great solutions, making adjustments along the way based on the results of experiments and on feedback from learners, instructors, university and industry partners, and partners organizations, worldwide.  
Your work will empower and motivate enterprise customer organizations (and their teams) to take timely and impactful actions in response to learner activity, and to shepherd people along their learning journeys to achieve mastery and career advancement.

jobs.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager, Enterprise Growth
jobs.description:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 190 of the world's top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 43 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. 2,000 companies trust our enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera for Government equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. Coursera is backed by investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group.  
Coursera for Business provides companies, governments and universities around the globe with skill development programs to help them thrive and stay competitive in a digital world.  The Coursera consumer ecosystem is a top channel for generating new leads for our business sales and this role will sit at the center of growing that resource.   
This multi-faceted product marketing role will partner with product, marketing and data science teams to develop and refine levers for expanding the consumer-to-business channels.  In addition to expanding the consumer channel, this person will also lead product marketing for our fast growing self-serve business for teams and SMBs. In this capacity, you will develop positioning, messaging and GTM strategies to drive acquisition, retention and growth with your cross-functional partners.   
This is a rare combination of product and digital marketing wrapped into one role that can make a meaningful difference in people’s lives around the world.  If this sounds like your dream job, we can’t wait to hear from you!

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Content Platform
jobs.description:
The Content Platform team works on the fundamental building blocks for Coursera's course experience. This experience is 2-sided: learners want to learn by engaging actively with material and in many cases, earn a credential supported by rigorous and robust assessments, while content-creation partners want to author and grade content efficiently and effectively, with tools and data providing a feedback loop that allows them to create high-quality content. As a platform-focused team, we seek impact by building a customizable experience that can be used for a wide range of users. 

Your responsiblies- 
* Design and implement scalable systems and infrastructures
* Measure your work thoroughly, analyze results, and generate hypotheses to drive new product changes through A/B testing
* Setup monitoring and testing of your APIs and services to better understand real time health of your products

Your skillls : 
* 3+ years of experience working in a relevant software engineering role
* Expertise in designing highly-scalable and performant micro-services and storage layers using common frameworks, languages, and infrastructure (e.g. Java, Play/Scala, MySql, Cassandra, Solr, Kafka)
* Comfortable working in a fast-moving team environment (we deploy many times a day!)
* Data-driven and strongly motivated by success and learnings through experiments and metrics analysis

jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is a Silicon Valley based company and we opened our second engineering office in Toronto in March 2019. We’re hiring a Test Engineer to join our new Toronto team. Test Engineering at Coursera is all about delivering high quality software used by millions of learners across the world. We are looking for someone who is innovative and passionate about quality. You will own testing of one or more major functionality of Coursera’s website from the definition of test plans to their implementation, reporting and automation.  We’re in the process of forming a Test Engineering team at Coursera, and this is a great opportunity to join as one of the earliest contributors and shapers of the team.  
Coursera’s Engineering teams are responsible for maintaining a scalable and reliable platform.  Engineering works to build interactive products for the worldwide learner community. We are made up of five teams: Development Infrastructure, Growth, Learner Experience, Partner Experience, and SDET Engineering. Every day, Engineering teams collaborate with cross-functional partners, including other engineers, data scientists, and product managers. Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Coursera was founded by two computer science professors at Stanford with a vision of providing life-transforming learning experiences to anyone, anywhere. It is the world’s largest online learning platform for higher education. 190 of the world's top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, and degrees that empower over 43 million learners around the world to achieve their career goals. 2,000 companies trust our enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera for Government equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. Coursera is backed by investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, GSV Capital, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group.

We are looking for someone with an interest in developing and maintaining highly scalable infrastructure on various cloud providers, like AWS and Google Cloud. The candidate should have at least 2 years of professional experience designing, building and maintaining infrastructure, as well as provisioning it. You should have good knowledge about security and scalability of infrastructure, too. We're looking for someone who would be interested and excited in changing the development environment and conducting a lot of experimentations. Good communication skills are a must - we are looking for a team player, not a rock-star.

jobs.title: Staff Software Test Engineer (Automation)
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
Coursera’s Engineering teams are responsible for maintaining a scalable and reliable platform.  Engineering works to build interactive products for the worldwide learner community. We are made up of five teams: Development Infrastructure, Growth, Learner Experience, Partner Experience, and SDET Engineering. Every day, Engineering teams collaborate with cross-functional partners, including other engineers, data scientists, and product managers. Test Engineering at Coursera is all about delivering high quality software used by millions of learners across the world. We are looking for someone who is innovative and passionate about quality. You will own testing of one or more major functionality of Coursera’s website from the definition of test plans to their implementation, reporting and automation.  We’re in the process of forming a Test Engineering team at Coursera, and this is a great opportunity to join as one of the earliest contributors and shapers of the team.  
Check out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)

jobs.title: Technical Account Manager
jobs.description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where  **53 million learners**  from around the world come to learn skills of the future.  **Nearly 200**  of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs.  **2,300 companies**  trust the company’s enterprise platform [Coursera for Business](https://www.coursera.org/business/) to transform their talent. [Coursera for Government](https://www.coursera.org/government) equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. [Coursera for Campus](https://www.coursera.org/campus/) empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group  
The Services team works to empower learners, partners, and enterprise customers to achieve their goals on Coursera.  The team is made up of four sub-teams: Learner Services, Partner Services, Program Management, and Teaching & Learning. We help learners succeed by implementing innovative systems and processes that solve problems. We also develop best practices and technical expertise to enable our partners to create high quality content. As strong advocates for the Coursera community, we work to align cross-functional teams and build scalable solutions to continuously improve the Coursera experience.   
Coursera is looking for a Technical Account Manager to join our Partner Services team. You will project manage key content items to launch as well as enable our university and industry partners’ success on our platform through providing world class professional services including: - Project management  - SME enablement  - Partner account plan development and execution  - Product consultation - Project management and advice - Technical case resolution - Partner onboarding - Cross-functional enablement.   
As the authority on the Coursera authoring platform, you will work closely with Business Development, Product, and Engineering to resolve issues, advocate partner needs, and make Coursera the very best place to launch high impact learning experiencesCheck out life at Coursera on [The Muse! ](https://www.themuse.com/profiles/coursera)
